Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
14.6 Numeric Functions and Operators
14.6.2 Mathematical Functions
Description: Return the largest integer value not greater than the argument

Returns the largest integer value not greater than
            X. Returns
            NULL if X is
            NULL.

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT FLOOR(1.23), FLOOR(-1.23);
        -> 1, -2

For exact-value numeric arguments, the return value has an
            exact-value numeric type. For string or floating-point
            arguments, the return value has a floating-point type.
